data.title: Breaking News English ESL Lesson Plan on Amy Winehouse
data.meta_description: News English Lessons: Free 13-Page ESL lesson plan on Amy Winehouse - Handouts, online activity, mp3... for teaching current events.
data.text:
1. AMY WINEHOUSE: Walk around the class and talk to other students about Amy Winehouse. Change partners often. Sit with your first partner(s) and share your findings.

2. CHAT: In pairs / groups, decide which of these topics or words from the article are most interesting and which are most boring.

singer / award-winning / worldwide fame / acclaim / addiction / rehab / songwriting / tribute / unique talent / eclectic style / outstanding vocalist / tragic loss / heartbroken

Have a chat about the topics you liked. Change topics and partners frequently.

3. TRIBUTE: Use the words below in sentences to make a tribute to Amy Winehouse. Complete this with your partner(s). Change partners and share what you wrote. Change and share again.

Tribute sentences

award-winning artist

worldwide fame

honest songwriting

unique talent

tributes

outstanding vocalist

4. ADDICTIONS: Students A strongly believe that one day, addictions will be a thing of the past; Students B strongly believe addictions will always be with us. Change partners again and talk about your conversations.

5. TALENT: What makes a singer so great? Rank these and share your rankings with your partner. Put the best at the top. Change partners and share your rankings again.

voice

musical style

ability to play an instrument

dances

interviews

fashion

live performances

songwriting ability

6. UNIQUE: Spend one minute writing down all of the different words you associate with the word ‘unique’. Share your words with your partner(s) and talk about them. Together, put the words into different categories.

WHILE READING / LISTENING

GAP FILL: Put the words into the gaps in the text.

LISTENING  Listen and fill in the gaps

Singer Amy Winehouse has been found dead at her home in London on Saturday, July the 23rd. The _____________________ just 27 years old, the same age as Kurt Cobain, Jimi Hendrix, Jim Morrison and Janis Joplin. Winehouse _____________________ and acclaim following the release of her album Back to Black in 2006, which won five Grammy awards and became the _____________________ of the 2000s. She had spent years battling alcohol and drug addiction. This _____________________ her personal life affected her ability to perform live and she was booed offstage for appearing too drunk to perform in 2011. She _____________________ and attempts to beat them in her smash hit Rehab, an example of _____________________ songwriting.

_____________________ the world following her death show what a unique talent she was and how much she will be missed. The BBC said: “With her gravelly _____________________, Amy Winehouse…won comparison with some of the great female singers such as Sarah Vaughan and Nina Simone.” Britain’s Daily Mail newspaper wrote: “_____________________ the outstanding _______________________. Without Amy, there would have been no Adele, no Duffy and no Lady Gaga.” It added: “The tragic loss of Amy Winehouse _____________________ young, if fatally troubled, life cut down in its prime. It has also cheated British music of a talent, at 27, whose best years _____________________.” Singer Rihanna tweeted: “I am genuinely heartbroken…#DearAmy.”

AFTER READING / LISTENING

1. WORD SEARCH: Look in your dictionary / computer to find collocates, other meanings, information, synonyms … for the words ‘unique’ and ‘talent’.

unique

talent

Share your findings with your partners.

Make questions using the words you found.

Ask your partner / group your questions.

2. ARTICLE QUESTIONS: Look back at the article and write down some questions you would like to ask the class about the text.

Share your questions with other classmates / groups.

Ask your partner / group your questions.

3. GAP FILL: In pairs / groups, compare your answers to this exercise. Check your answers. Talk about the words from the activity. Were they new, interesting, worth learning…?

4. VOCABULARY: Circle any words you do not understand. In groups, pool unknown words and use dictionaries to find their meanings.

5. TEST EACH OTHER: Look at the words below. With your partner, try to recall how they were used in the text:

LANGUAGE  MULTIPLE CHOICE

Singer Amy Winehouse has been found dead at her home in London on Saturday, July the 23rd. The award-(1) ____ artist was just 27 years old, the same age as Kurt Cobain, Jimi Hendrix, Jim Morrison and Janis Joplin. Winehouse (2) ____ to worldwide fame and (3) ____ following the release of her album Back to Black in 2006, which won five Grammy awards and became the third-highest selling album of the 2000s. She had spent years battling alcohol and drug addiction. (4) ____ and other demons in her personal life affected her ability to perform (5) ____ and she was booed offstage for appearing too drunk to perform in 2011. She sang about her addictions and attempts to beat them (6) ____ her smash hit Rehab, an example of her gritty and honest songwriting.

Tributes from across the world (7) ____ her death show what a unique talent she was and how much she will be missed. The BBC said: “With her gravelly voice and eclectic (8) ____, Amy Winehouse…won comparison with some of the great female singers such as Sarah Vaughan and Nina Simone.” Britain’s Daily Mail newspaper wrote: “She was without (9) ____ the outstanding vocalist of her generation. Without Amy, there would have been no Adele, no Duffy and no Lady Gaga.” It added: “The (10) ____ loss of Amy Winehouse has robbed us of a young, if fatally troubled, life cut down (11) ____ its prime. It has also cheated British music of a talent, at 27, whose best years surely still lay (12) ____.” Singer Rihanna tweeted: “I am genuinely heartbroken…#DearAmy.”

HOMEWORK

1. VOCABULARY EXTENSION: Choose several of the words from the text. Use a dictionary or Google’s search field (or another search engine) to build up more associations / collocations of each word.

2. INTERNET: Search the Internet and find out more about Amy Winehouse. Share what you discover with your partner(s) in the next lesson.

3. SONGS: Make a poster about one of Amy Winehouse’s songs. Show your work to your classmates in the next lesson.

4. AMY WINEHOUSE: Write a magazine article about Amy Winehouse and her music. Include imaginary interviews with her fans.

Read what you wrote to your classmates in the next lesson. Write down any new words and expressions you hear from your partner(s).

5. LETTER: Write a letter to a music magazine. Ask three questions about Amy Winehouse. Give three of your opinions on her music. Read your letter to your partner(s) in your next lesson. Your partner(s) will answer your questions.

PHRASE MATCH:

GAP FILL:

Amy Winehouse dies, aged 27

Singer Amy Winehouse has been (1) found dead at her home in London on Saturday, July the 23rd. The award-winning (2) artist was just 27 years old, the same age as Kurt Cobain, Jimi Hendrix, Jim Morrison and Janis Joplin. Winehouse (3) shot to worldwide fame and acclaim following the release of her album Back to Black in 2006, which won five Grammy awards and became the third-highest (4) selling album of the 2000s. She had spent years (5) battling alcohol and drug addiction. This and other (6) demons in her personal life affected her ability to perform live and she was booed offstage for appearing too drunk to perform in 2011. She sang about her addictions and (7) attempts to beat them in her smash hit Rehab, an example of her gritty and (8) honest songwriting.

Tributes from across the world (9) following her death show what a unique talent she was and how much she will be (10) missed. The BBC said: “With her gravelly voice and eclectic style, Amy Winehouse…won (11) comparison with some of the great female singers such as Sarah Vaughan and Nina Simone.” Britain’s Daily Mail newspaper wrote: “She was without (12) question the outstanding vocalist of her generation. Without Amy, there would have been no Adele, no Duffy and no Lady Gaga.” It added: “The (13) tragic loss of Amy Winehouse has (14) robbed us of a young, if fatally troubled, life cut down in its prime. It has also cheated British music of a talent, at 27, whose best years (15) surely still lay ahead.” Singer Rihanna tweeted: “I am (16) genuinely heartbroken…#DearAmy.”
